basics.name: Miles Cobb Dumlao
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2027.

work.summary: Software Development and Product Management Intern
highlights: Used React with TypeScript to redesign the Xbox.com error page, a page encountered 96 million times in 2 months

Developed components in React with TypeScript that allowed the marketing team to edit the Xbox.com error page without needing a developer, improving the experience of Xbox.com users and the Xbox marketing team
Implemented custom React hooks and custom tags to gather data from the error page, giving the Xbox marketing team metrics to measure success and to improve the error page
Earned Secret-level security clearance and worked with classified documents to ensure federal compliance, boosting the security of secret-level information
Shadowed Cybersecurity professionals at a Regional Cyber Center supporting 30,000 users across the Pacific
Aided in planning a career fair at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa with over 100 student and employer participants
Created the sign-up process and developed performance metrics to evaluate event success and gather feedback for future events
Completed projects for the University of Hawaiʻi using the 8-bit tech stack: Git, Github, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React.js, MySQL, ExpressJS

awards.title: Fred and Annie Chan Scholarship Fund for Information and Computer Sciences
awards.summary: Awarded to students majoring in computer science with at least a 3.0 GPA

awards.title: Charles R. Hemenway Scholarship Trust - UH Manoa
awards.summary: Awarded to undergraduate students of any major
